title: Is it illegal to write words on the school walls? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Were you given permission by the owner or manager of the building? If not, it’s vandalism, and yes, it’s illegal. Look up the laws where you live and you can find how vandalism is defined and what the penalties are. As a school principal, I occasionally had kids write on the school walls, and one time on a teacher’s car. I always called the police. They always investigated and prosecuted. Penalties usually involved a fine, about $500 for the first offense, plus money paid to the owner of the school or the vehicle to cover the cost of restoring the item vandalized to new condition, and that could be several hundred dollars more. Not a good idea.

Writing words on the school walls has been considered illegal in my country since I was elementary student and such act is considered by school management as a vandalism. Any student gets caught writing or painting on school walls will be scolded and punished accordingly. But nowadays some students dare to express their feelings, protests or dislikes for school management by writing on the school walls like this  It says “ Signed by students, The headmaster is incapable of doing his jobs, he has failed “
